awd_titl_txt: Ecological Interactions and the Dynamics of a Semi-aquatic  Insect
awd_abstract_narration: The proposed research will consider several situations in                  which natural and sexual selection function together and in                     opposition to one another, and how an organism can behave in a                  way that maximizes its fitness.  The research combines field                    surveys, field experiments, and laboratory experiments.  These                  experiments will examine the interacting effects of predation                   risk, density, and sex ratio in Gerris remigis, a species of                    aquatic insect.                                                                      The research will produce new insights into how natural                    selection and sexual selection interact to shape evolution.                     Additional knowledge of how stream ecology may be affected by the               destruction of surrounding land should also result from this                    work.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: UNIVERSITY OF KENTUCKY RESEARCH FOUNDATION, THE
